title: Golden Ticket
description: Michael asks Dwight to be the scapegoat for one of his business ideas that backfired badly on him. But when that idea has an unexpected positive upside, Dwight still takes credit and Michael becomes furious.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] Yeah, that's no problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] Sure. Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam? Knock, knock.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know you are. Knock, knock.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] You can fax it over. Yeah, 5-7-0-5-5-5-0-1-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [at same time as Pam] 4-9-1-7-4-5-1

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: 0-1-7-5. Thank you. Bye, bye. [to Michael] It really makes us look unprofessional.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They would never know it was me doing it. Here we go, Knock, knock. [Dwight walks over]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] Who's there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Buddha.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Buddha who?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [puts a slice of bread and stick of butter on Pam's desk] Buddha this bread for me, won't you? [Michael and Dwight laugh]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, I need something to wipe my hand.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Now there's, there's butter on my desk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was helping. It was classic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got a knock-knock joke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No... God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, Michael, please, please, please, please, please let me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clears throat] Knock, knock.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's there?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: KGB.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: KGB - [Dwight slaps Michael on the face]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in Russian accent] We will ask the questions!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell was that? [Michael starts to fight with Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey! Hey! Stop it! Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You, you like that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: C'mon. What are you doing? Mine was a part of my hilarious joke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mine was retribution. What are you doing? No more knock-knock jokes. That's it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ding Dong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Jim] Who's there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: KGB.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, get the door.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not answering it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Answer the door.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ding dong.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No way, it's the KGB.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ding dong.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not answering that. You answer it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not gonna answer it

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not gonna answer it, it's the KGB. [Jim slaps Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The KGB will wait for no one! [Michael laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's true.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Michael walks in dressed as Willy Wonka] Good morning, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no, no. I am not Michael. I am Willy Wonkaaaaa.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good morning, Mr. Wonka, here are your messages.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why thank you very much. [notices jelly beans] Oh, what are those? What are those? Tell me, please!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jelly beans.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. They are not just ordinary jelly beans little girl. These are extraordinary jelly beans!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Willy Wonka Golden Ticket promotional idea is probably the best idea I have ever had. It's probably the best idea anybody has ever had. Three days ago, I slipped five pieces of gold paper into random paper shipments. This entitles the customer to ten percent off of their total order. It will be a day for them that is full of whimsy, and full of excitement and full of fantasy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've written these things because it is my responsibility, as manager of this branch, to profiligate great ideas and I think I have done my part with the golden ticket promotion. Now it is your turn. I want to hear some great ideas from you that are just as good as mine. [Jim raises hand] Umm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We own our own delivery trucks. We could lease them out on the weekends --

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Too many words. Good ideas are simple. 'Golden ticket.'

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: 'Free paper.'

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Jim. We're a business. Post-its. That is a golden ticket idea. NASA took five or six golden ticket ideas to get man on the moon.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Golden Girls. That's a golden ticket idea, right, I mean how great was that show? Golden Grahams. Another, is it -- I don't get this...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you don't. No, it - [sighs] What will be the state of this company if I am the only one coming up with the great ideas? Right?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think I should call her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No! No! No!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Why is it so bad for me to call and ask her to lunch today?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sighs] You're making it too easy for her. You're just conveying, 'Oh I like you just the way you are.'

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But I do like her just the way she is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well that's not what we agreed on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Kevin] Why don't you just go out on a date with her? Try to spark up an on going joke and then in a month or two, if it feels right, you'll know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You don't have to wait that long. I mean, you don't have to wait a month to ask her out. Just ask her out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're asking him to give up all of his power.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What power?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy, Pam, and Jim are all telling me how to deal with this girl that I like, Lynn. I, I don't like getting advice from more than one person at a time. I'm a textbook over-thinker.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You can't let a girl feel good about herself. It will backfire on you. Every compliment has to be backhanded. 'Oh I like your dress, but I'd like it more if you had prettier hair.'

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's psychotic. Do guys actually do that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well guys with girlfriends don't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's low, Tuna.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Tom. What's that? Oh, you found a golden ticket. [puts hand on receiver and speaks to office] One of my clients found a golden ticket. [Michael screams in excitement] [Jim back on phone] Yup. No, congratulations. [Michael dances in background]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woo hoo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] I'll take that down right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell me; was it a spoiled little girl with big lips...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...or an odd little boy with a cowboy obsession?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Hold on one second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Invite them on the tour.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Michael] It's actually Blue Cross from Pennsylvania.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? That's kind of a big client. [gets up and heads toward Oscar] Hey, Oscar. Woo hoo hoo. Um, how much of a hit is ten percent of our Blue Cross account?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ten percent?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: They're our largest client.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's gonna hurt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Hold on one sec. Hold on one sec, Tom, what's that? You found five golden tickets? And does it say limit one per customer? Nope, it doesn't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How do you not spread out the tickets into different shipments?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I thought I did. So...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well no harm no foul.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ...well I'm going to call corporate to make sure that they know I didn't lose half my sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You didn't, but... it'll be fine. It'll be good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Hey. Hey. You idiot.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Start over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sir. I placed a bunch of golden tickets into five separate boxes and some how they all ended up with Blue Cross. How does this happen?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Were the boxes near each other?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Irrelevant.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I put three pallets on the truck to Blue Cross once a week. They use a lot of paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, I'm going to ask you something and I want you to be honest. What is a pallet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My golden ticket idea? OK. Why would anyone think that this is my golden ticket idea? There is a one in 13 chance that this could be anybody's golden ticket idea. [sighs] That... [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Oh hi ,David. [Michael shakes his head to Pam] No, I'm sorry he's not back from the Civil Rights rally. I'll have him call you the minute he gets back from the Lincoln Memorial.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When Michael's skirting a phone call, he gave me a list of places to say he is. 'Stopping a fight in the parking lot. ' 'An Obama fashion show. ' Whatever... that is. Or 'trapped in an oil painting.' I'm gonna save that one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nobody panic. The good news is... they can't fire all of us, right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: They can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, they can't.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, they can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, you don't know what the hell you are talking about.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, what do you think shutting down a branch is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, then we're screwed. I am just a net that traps all of your crappy subconscious ideas and adds a little bit of my own childhood memories and whimsy, so -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, well I lost a ton of money today and I have a mortgage, so I'm a little pissed too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Jim is with me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely not, I'm mad at you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well you know what Jim? It is not my fault that you bought a house to impress Pam. That is why carnations exist.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That's not why.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, we need a gold ticket idea to get us out of this mess. [Pam raises hand] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Does that mean an idea that blows up in our faces later? [Pam's phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, don't get that. Please? [Pam gets up to answer her phone]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I've got a golden ticket idea. Why don't you skip on up to the roof and jump off?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is not constructive.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Oh hi, David. He's having a colonoscopy. Alright, I'll find out if he's out yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello David. I just got back from my procedure, so-

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on speaker phone] Michael, what the hell is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How are you doing?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Fine. What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reading from computer] My colonoscopy was an examination of my large colon and the distal part of my small bowel with a camera.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Why did you OK this golden ticket idea? We're going to lose a fortune, Michael. How could you let this happen?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, there is an explanation that involves me not letting it happen and I just don't... I don't know.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: How could you not know Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think we might have hired an outside marketing consultant.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Might have hi-- OK, what firm?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're breaking up.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, I think, it might have been an inside consultant.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Was it the sales department?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Was it Jim?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: OK, was it Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [long pause] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight walks in] Come on in. Good to see ya, have a seat. I just wanted to congratulate you on that great golden ticket idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That was your idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woah, wow, who told you that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You did. Several times. Over and over again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [same time as Dwight] No, I don't think I ever did. That was your idea Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [same time as Michael] You were dressed as Willy Wonka so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not taking... I'm not taking...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wasn't my idea. Loved - but I can't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait a second, wait a second, I wrote it down in my diary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't keep a diary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes I do. You've just never seen it. [reading from diary] March 4th. Dwight came up with the best idea today about golden tickets.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hold that thought. [Dwight gets up and gets own diary from desk and returns] [flipping through diary] March... 4th. Michael Scott came up with golden ticket idea to give five customers ten perfect off for one year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why do you have a diary?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: To keep secrets from my computer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, you know what? You came up with this idea. I remember you told me that you loved the Willy Wonka movie when you were growing up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impossible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, you did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wasn't given candy as a child, so a movie that fetish-ized it that much, would have made no sense to me. Plus, we weren't allowed to see movies. So... do the math.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you writing? [Dwight writes in diary]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Had conversation with Michael about taking credit for an idea that wasn't mine. Discussed movies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you like to go to lunch with me? Just the two of us?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: With all my heart.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You guys are throwing a lot at me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All I'm saying is that it's a first dates, so just keep a respectful distance.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think Jim means to say that you shouldn't touch her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that is what I mean.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Shush. [to Kevin] Kevin, a playful touch on the arm, or on the back, it can show your interest and it's really romantic.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [puts hand on Jim's hand] Like that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, stop it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't touch her. Don't talk to her. Don't look at her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Jim, Andy and Pam all talking over each other] ...turn into this black and carbon brick-where this barbeque sauce of shame and rage and two hot people with a perfect relationship would not understand that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We think a lot alike. Sometimes you will think something and I will say what you're thinking-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, what am I thinking right now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Umm, nacho chips.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No... How skin is the largest organ of the body.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK. Let me just cut to the chase, Dwight. I want you to fall on your sword for me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I did fall on my sword once. I was running with it in my belt. Won't happen again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why do you even want to stay at Dunder Mifflin? I mean what's the point? You're cooped up in there all day. You don't get to do your farming. You're not dating Angela anymore. It doesn't matter if you get fired for taking credit for the gold ticket idea. It doesn't matter. Me on the other hand, I would be lost without this place. You, way too manly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about Shoe La La?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] It's not ready yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have an idea for a fancy men's shoe store called Shoe La La. And it's just men's shoes for the special occasions in a man's life, like the day that you get married or the day your wife has a baby, or for just lounging around the house.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: May I have your attention please. I have an announcement. Mr. Dwight Schrute and I just returned from a wonderful stroll together and although I probably will never do it again, I had fun. I really had fun with my best friend, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: These aren't announcements.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes they are, you just don't care about the information.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I love working here and I do not want to leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He doesn't love it that much. Wouldn't be such a bad thing for him to be fired.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I mean, like we were talking about that is why he has come to the conclusion...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We discussed the fact that I'm cooped up here instead of experiencing the whole wide world.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No plowing my own acres. Going around shirtless all day. You know experiencing freedom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's it. That's it. You can't put a price on freedom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Try me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's why you made the decision. That's why you made...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I haven't made a decision yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You kind of have.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You cannot take the fall for him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He said he would do the same for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He can do the same for you. Right now. By getting fired instead of you. So what are you gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna go back to work. After I write you up for insubordination.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [seeing David Wallace come into the office] Oh my God. Dwight! Dwight! Get in-- what's it gonna be, what are you gonna do? [Dwight runs into Michael's office] What's it gonna be? Are you gonna do this thing for me? Dwight? [David knocks on Michael's door and opens door] Hey David, how are you? Good to see you. Nice surprise. Dwight and I were just having a very unfortunate conversation.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: That's too bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is, but it had to be done, didn't it?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hopefully, nothing that can't be undone because Dwight I owe you an apology. The head of Blue Cross just called. They were so excited about the golden ticket discount that they have decided to make Dunder Mifflin their exclusive provider of all office supplies. Congratulations Dwight. [holds out hand for handshake]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: David... you're welcome. [Dwight and David shake hands and make exclamations]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I just want to say that this golden ticket idea is one of the most brilliant signs of initiative I have ever seen at this company and how about a big round of applause for Mr. Dwight Schrute? [everyone starts clapping]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Alright Dwight. This is huge.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's what she said! [David laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight, great idea. Dwight, Dwight, great idea. How'd you come up with that idea?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Inspiration.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? How did- how are you inspired?  How did it pop into your head Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [same time as Michael] You never know when it's gonna strike. Just... boom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me the details of how that happened.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You, you are taking about Dwight Schrute. The biggest Wonka fan I know. I mean, you've been talking about that movie for years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And you know what? I even made fun of you when you dressed up as Willy Wonka to pitch this idea and for that I apologize.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Apology rejected.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [going up to give Dwight a hug] Thanks for much for helping the company, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh Pam.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Good work, kid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks old man.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: This, this is great. OH, OK, look I want to get you on the horn with the marketing people in New York. The should meet you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Pam, could you set up a call in there in about 15 minutes, please?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David? David?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [same time as Michael] 'Cause I've got this idea...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could I be a part of the meeting also?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You probably have too much to do around here. I don't want to uh, take up your time with another meeting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, let's face it. This meeting sounds like it's Wonka fans only. He's never seen the movie. [David laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] Hey guys, I have with me Dwight Schrute. Dwight, take it away.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK guys, listen up. Here's the deal. I love candy. Sweet sugary candy from the second it touches my tongue to the moment it's metabolized by my stomach acids, so naturally I liked Willy Wonka.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Wait, do you guys hear that? There's not a dog listening in, is there? [cut to show Michael on the other line] I hear panting.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No. No dogs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So I love Willy Wonka. That golden ticket scene is so inspiring to me that that's where I cam up with that idea [Michael comes into conference room].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is no movie called Willy Wonka. It's called Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's actually based on a book called Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't... vouch for that. But I do know this. He is a liar. He has taken my idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is my idea.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] We are gonna call you back guys. [to Michael] What is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, here's what happened, David. It was all my idea. You called me and you were really angry at me and I got scared, so I had Dwight take the fall, but now, it turns out that it's a great idea and Dwight will not confess. Can you believe that?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is my idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh how dare you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is my idea. I'm filled with good ideas. Thousands of good ideas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are? Good ideas, huh? Hey, did you come up with toilet buddy? It's a net, circular net, that you put inside the toilet to catch all of your change and your wallet from falling into the toilet? Formally known as toilet guard?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Horse Boat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A canoe built around your horse so you can go from riding to water travel without slowing down. Horse Boat!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toilet sponge. It's a hollowed out sponge...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh give me a break.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...that is more absorbent, and softer than toilet paper. I have a lot of toilet ideas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's because they're easy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They're not easy. Everybody has to go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [same time as Michael] Women's urinals... uh...

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [same time as Michael and Dwight] Guys, guys. OK, enough. Please, enough. What, is this true, Dwight? I mean, is this true?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, it's Michael's idea that he forced on me on threat of death.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank You!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What, I don't -- what do you want me to do now, Michael? What am I supposed to do now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well David, I will be honest with you. I do want the credit without any of the blame.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: OK, uhh... I am going back to New York. Pam, do me a favor, don't send me those notes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I am gone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When they look back on this day in the history books all that will be remembered is that I had a good idea. And that's what I am going to write down in my diary. That is what I want you to write down in yours.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh I am. In my own words.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want to see it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want to see it. [Michael gets up to try to see Dwight's diary]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me...  Give me the diary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! [Michael struggles to take Dwight's diary from his hand]

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Lynn, I'm just gonna say to you everything that I am thinking.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think you have the best smile. I'd like to take you out to dinner and a movie.

quotes.speaker: Lynn
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice. [Both laugh] Boobs. [Lynn blushes]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, it's uh, his funeral. So... neh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ding dong.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: KGB.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. I just got out of the shower, I'll be one second.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in accent] When you are done, open the door. ... Hello in there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm late for work, so I have to brush my teeth, it's a whole routine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We have more houses to visit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If you want to come back then, that'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We will come back at... how is [looks at watch] 4:45?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I get back from work around 6.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How about 5:15?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You can try. That, that might work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very well, we will come back at 5:15.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.
